alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 30 at 4:25PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Cumming affecting Forsyth County. For the Big Creek...including Cumming...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Big Creek near Cumming. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Between 6 and 7 feet, Minor flooding will expand into the natural flood plain of the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at Atlanta Highway or Georgia Highway 9. Large portions of the sidewalk and boardwalk of the Big Creek Greenway will begin to flood. The areas under the Georgia 400 Highway and McFarland Road will be covered with around one foot of water. A portion of the sidewalk under Majors Road will be covered with around two feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling through early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
